definition: to face/to overlook/to arrive/to be (just) about to/just before
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
to be facing imminent calamity (idiom)/disaster is looming
when things come to a head (idiom)
facing imminent catastrophe/calamity looms/all hell will break loose
facing the end (idiom); at the end of one's life/with one foot in the grave

sentences.english: I have been exposed to the presentiment of catastrophe for weeks.
sentences.chinese: 幾星期來我一直有大禍臨頭的感覺。

sentences.english: A presentiment of the future; a foreboding.
sentences.chinese: 他一直有禍事臨頭的預感。

sentences.english: For me, the july twentieth affair was in every way a calamity .
sentences.chinese: 就我來說，七月二十日事件完全是大禍臨頭。

sentences.english: During the past the week, I almost always feeling having disaster strikes.
sentences.chinese: 幾星期來我一直有大禍臨頭的感覺。

sentences.english: A rise in interest rates would be disastrous for millions.
sentences.chinese: 利率的增長對數百萬人來說是大禍臨頭。

sentences.english: He had a presentiment of trouble coming.
sentences.chinese: 他一直有禍事臨頭的預感。

sentences.english: He spoke darkly of possible future disaster .
sentences.chinese: 他悲觀地說將來可能大難臨頭。

sentences.english: "Without collective awakening the catastrophe will come, " he warns.
sentences.chinese: 如果沒有集體的覺醒，大禍即將臨頭。

sentences.english: Here I am talkingtummy-rot about civilization, when your Tara's in danger.
sentences.chinese: 你的德園大難臨頭，我卻還在講什麼關於文明的廢話。

sentences.english: Damn boys don't think about the wrath that's about to set down on them.
sentences.chinese: 混小子，也不想想，他們就快要大禍臨頭了。

sentences.english: And they abode there, they and their children, and their wives, and their cattle: because afflictions increased upon them.
sentences.chinese: 將子女妻室牲畜也一同帶了去，因爲大難已臨頭上。

sentences.english: Oh, calamity , is there no way out?
sentences.chinese: 噢大禍臨頭了這下可有生路？

sentences.english: "This is a catastrophe for Iran's cinema, " he said.
sentences.chinese: “這對伊朗的電影業來說是大禍臨頭，”他說。

sentences.english: If you don't anticipate what may happen, you'll find yourself at a loss when sth. crops up.
sentences.chinese: 你如果沒有思想準備，事到臨頭就會抓瞎。

sentences.english: The possibility of being made redundant has been a sword of Damocles hanging over me for several months now.
sentences.chinese: 裁員的可能性好幾個月來一直使我大難臨頭的危險。

sentences.english: For weeks, I have had a feeling of impending disaster.
sentences.chinese: 幾星期來我一直有大禍臨頭的感覺。
